newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico May manufacturing employment up 5.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Mexico May manufacturing employment up 5.7 pct.

text.p: Employment in Mexico's manufacturing sector rose an average 5.7 percent during May compared with the same month a year ago, the National Statistics Institute (INEGI) said in a statement on Monday.
The index of hours worked rose by an average 6.2 percent year over year, the INEGI said.
Workers' real wages within the sector rose by 0.9 percent in real terms, it added.
Every manufacturing sector showed a rise in employment, led by precision machinery, gauges, jewelry and silver.
